ns0:StringWithMarkup.ns0:String: LC50 Gammarus fasciatus (scuds) 0.27 ug/l/96 hr at 15 °C, mature (95% confidence limit 0.21-0.35 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95.5%/

LC50 Salmo gairdneri (rainbow trout) 140 ug/l/96 hr at 13 °C, wt 1.5 g (95% confidence limit 122-161 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95.5%/

LC50 Ictalurus punctatus (channel catfish) 240 ug/l/96 hr at 18 °C, wt 0.7 g (95% confidence limit 110-550 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95.5%/

LC50 Lepomis macrochirus (bluegill) 320 ug/l/96 hr at 18 °C, wt 1.1 g (95% confidence limit 142-735 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95.5%/

LC50 Lepomis microlophus (redear sunfish) less than 140 ug/l/96 hr at 18 °C, wt 2.5 g. Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 95.5%/
LD50 Anas platyrhynchos (mallard duck) oral above 2000 mg/kg, male, 3-4 months old
LD50 oral Agelaius phoeniceus (redwinged blackbird) 100 mg/kg; avian repellency value: R50 = 40.0 mg/kg; repellency toxicity index (hazard factor) = -0.4.
